page.title: 17Dorset Farms 1
page.content:
Our area is mostly grassland and woodland, with some crops. Farmers store grass for the winter as silage, or the cows eat it in the fields.
We have been to 5 farms. Three of these are dairy farms. The first one had 145 cows. The second had 53, and the last one had 2. At Lazerton Farm where there are only two cows, they are milked by hand.
It was interesting that one farm was formerly 500 acres, now it is only 94 acres. Another farm has 380 acres.
Ash Farm can't have any farm animals because it has got something wrong with the ground. They do have some deer which were just out in the open. So Ash Farm grows wheat,rape,grass seed and peas.
